sentences: Ota laatikko ja vie se varastoon.
context: Laatikko is a Finnish noun that translates to 'box' or 'drawer' in English. It can also refer to a casserole, especially when discussing food. The word originates from Old Swedish and has connections to similar words in other Germanic languages.  The ending '-kko' is a common suffix for nouns in Finnish. The dictionary definitions show different forms of the word including plural (laatikot) and various cases indicating its role in a sentence. Possessive forms are also provided, showing how it changes depending on who owns the box (e.g., laatikkomme - our box).
